title: JSX Basics
description: Learn how JSX works and why React uses it to build UI

intro.title: The Language of React
intro.story: React does not understand HTML directly. It speaks a special language called JSX.
intro.preview: You will learn how JSX turns ideas into visible screens.

refresher.title: üß± Real-World Story: Lego Blocks
refresher.content:
# Think Like Lego Imagine Lego blocks: - Blocks look colorful - Inside, they are plastic JSX looks like HTML But inside, it is JavaScript --- ## What is JSX? JSX = JavaScript + HTML-like syntax Example: `

Hello

` This is not HTML. It becomes JavaScript behind the scenes. --- ## Why JSX? Without JSX: `React.createElement('h1', null, 'Hello')` With JSX: `

Hello

` JSX is easier to read and write.

options.explanation: Correct. JSX must be wrapped inside a single parent.

negative.lesson: Wrap multiple elements inside a parent or fragment.

concept.title: üì¶ JSX Rules
concept.content:
## Important JSX Rules 1. Only one parent element 2. Use `className` instead of `class` 3. JavaScript inside `{ }` 4. JSX expressions must return a value --- Example: `

{2 + 2}

` Result: 4
